posts.post_content: It's not bad just too expensive, but it is a powerful effect and in the multicolored Alara cards things like [Tendrils of Corruption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tendrils of Corruption) are less effective, it would be much better saying target creature or player, and/or if the landcylcing had a do one damage like [Complicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Complicate). The art is nice but that doesn't make it just a good.

posts.post_content: Absorb Vis is definitely over-costed. If it could target creatures, it might be slightly more playable. The basic landcycling keyword ability is neat, and certainly useful in a set like Conflux (which begs players to play many colors at once), but it doesn't compensate for such a high casting cost. These basic landcycling cards might be good with some of the cycling mechanics of yesteryear, like [Astral Slide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Astral Slide) and [Lightning Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Rift).
posts.html:
Absorb Vis is definitely over-costed. If it could target creatures, it might be slightly more playable. The basic landcycling keyword ability is neat, and certainly useful in a set like Conflux (which begs players to play many colors at once), but it doesn't compensate for such a high casting cost. These basic landcycling cards might be good with some of the cycling mechanics of yesteryear, like Astral Slide and Lightning Rift.

posts.post_content: It goes well in a deck where you need to fill slots to make up 60 cards but without it *really* being like 60 cards. Like a [Protean Hulk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Protean Hulk) deck where you need him and the land to play him but need to keep the rest of the cards in the deck to be summoned by his effect. These, [Krosan Tusker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krosan Tusker), [Verdant Catacombs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdant Catacombs), [Worldly Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldly Tutor) all work together to guarantee the Hulk and some land. It's not THAT terrible in that respect. Hard casting this for the drain 4 is absolute balls though.
posts.html:
It goes well in a deck where you need to fill slots to make up 60 cards but without it really being like 60 cards. Like a Protean Hulk deck where you need him and the land to play him but need to keep the rest of the cards in the deck to be summoned by his effect. These, Krosan Tusker, Verdant Catacombs, Worldly Tutor all work together to guarantee the Hulk and some land. It's not THAT terrible in that respect. Hard casting this for the drain 4 is absolute balls though.

posts.post_content: Huh, it's an [Evolving Wilds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evolving Wilds) that costs {1}{B} to activate but brings the land out untapped. (The effect has to be bad because it is in a very meaningful sense a free card to put in the deck)
